712772f-a.text:
42nd Street, south side, west from the clearing at No. 340 East 42nd Street, Prospect Hill, between First and Second Avenues,
as the Tudor City development begins.
May 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

712774f.text:
42nd Street, west from First Avenue, through the Prospect Hill
tunnel under the future site of Tudor City.
Probably 1927.
Brown Brothers.

712792f-a.text:
East 42nd Street (prominent structures thereon) west from First (right, not seen) to Lexington (left) Aves., showing the Chrysler and the News Buildings under construction. The first is at the N.E. corner of Lexington AVe. and 42nd Street, while the latter is on the south side of 42nd Street, between First and Second Aves. Photographers Eantage point is atop a roof on 40th Street, east of Second Ave. and viewing northwestward.
August 16, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

712768f-a.text:
East 42nd Street, south side, west from the East River to First Ave. Shown in the background, are two units of Tudor City; the Windsor Tower (left)
and the Tudor Tower (right).
March 31, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

712775f-b.text:
Eas t 42nd Street, west from First Avenue, showing the enclosed passageway thrbhugh which the streetcars pass. Atop same is the residential locale, Tudor City. This in earlier days was a rocky wasteland populated by a group of "Shanty Irish" led by one, Cocoran, and for whom this became known as "Cocoran's Roost".
July 23, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

712795f-a.text:
East 42nd Street, west from 1st Avenue, showing there,the utilitarian News Building. Same,obstructs a clear iew of the Chrysler Building at Lexington Avenue. The photographer's direction is northwestward
from a point on E. 40th Street.
1939
Gift of Beecher Ogden
